description: President Emmanuel Macron called on French lawmakers to set aside their personal ambition and reject a vote that would topple the government and throw the country into political turmoil.
title: Macron Asks French Lawmakers Not to Topple the Government

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s pick to run the Drug Enforcement Administration, Chad Chronister, said Tuesday that he was withdrawing his name from consideration for the post.
title: Trump’s DEA Pick Withdraws After Criticism of Covid Lockdowns

description: Donald Trump’s lawyers told a judge that his New York hush money conviction must be dismissed as a result of his election victory, arguing that the president-elect was unfairly targeted by prosecutors.
title: Trump Says Hush-Money Case Must Be Tossed, Citing Biden Pardon

description: China’s move to ban exports of rare metals to the US underscores the need for trade cooperation between mineral-rich Canada and its southern neighbor.
title: Canada Mining Group Uses China Ban to Push Back on Trump Tariffs

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s transition team said Tuesday they had signed an agreement with the US Department of Justice which would allow the agency to begin vetting potential picks for the incoming administration.
title: Trump Transition Team Signs DOJ Agreement to Allow Vetting of Picks

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior Supreme Court correspondent Greg Stohr previews a case that will put the high court in the middle of a cultural clash. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Campaign Culture War Over Transgender Rights Moves to Supreme Court

description: Bond traders are positioning for the US Treasuries market to extend its recent advance, showing confidence that yields will continue to pull back from the peaks hit after Donald Trump’s election victory.
title: Bond Traders Position for US Treasury Market to Extend Rebound

description: Czech lawmakers voted to extend one of Europe’s most aggressive fiscal-austerity programs that has already damped economic growth and curbed the government’s popularity a year before elections.
title: Czech Lawmakers Approve More Budget Austerity for Election Year

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s vision for American energy dominance promises “certainty” that will encourage more investments in oil and gas, Alaska Governor Mike Dunleavy said.
title: Alaska Governor Sees ‘Certainty’ for Oil, Gas Under Trump

description: Namibia’s ruling party held onto power despite its worst-ever electoral showing as its candidate Netumbo Nandi-Ndaitwah became the first woman to win the presidency in the sparsely populated southwest African nation.
title: Namibian Ruling Party Holds Onto Power in Worst Election Showing

description: Donald Trump’s penchant for making policy proposals on his nascent social media platform has made the site a must-follow for swaths of Wall Street, Washington and the media. The rise in use from the president-elect, though, hasn’t led to any meaningful boost in users.
title: Trump’s Truth Social Posts Fail to Deliver Big Traffic Surge

description: Social Security employee union secures hybrid work deal until 2029
title: Thousands of Federal Employees Land Work From Home Deal Ahead of Trump

description: Namibia’s ruling party won the most seats in the nation’s parliamentary election as its candidate Netumbo Nandi-Ndaitwah became the first woman to win the presidency in the sparsely populated southwest African nation.
title: Nandi-Ndaitwah Is Elected as Namibia’s First Female President

description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol said he will lift his martial law decree, just hours after his dramatic move imposing it Tuesday.
title: South Korea’s Yoon Says He Will Lift Martial Law

description: Transgender rights will reach a legal turning point Wednesday as the US Supreme Court considers the constitutionality of state laws that ban gender-affirming treatments for minors.
title: Transgender Rights Face Test at Supreme Court Over State Bans of Youth Care

description: The largest umbrella union in South Korea declared its opposition to President Yoon Suk Yeol’s declaration of martial law, calling for a general strike to force him to reverse course.
title: Korea’s Largest Union Calls for Strike to Oppose Martial Law

description: The Bank of Korea’s monetary policy board said it will hold an extraordinary meeting Wednesday morning to discuss steps to shield the economy and markets after President Yoon Suk Yeol’s martial law declaration.
title: Bank of Korea to Hold Emergency Meeting After Yoon’s Martial Law

description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa moved Justice and Constitutional Development Minister Thembi Nkadimeng-Simelane to a new department, amid an investigation into her conduct before she joined the cabinet.
title: South African President Switches Justice Minister Amid Probe

description: President Emmanuel Macron said he thinks the French government can survive a no-confidence vote on Wednesday, when the far-right party of Marine Le Pen is expected to join forces with a left-wing coalition to topple the administration.
title: Macron Says France’s Government Can Survive No-Confidence Vote

description: A US Secret Service agent is under investigation after firing their gun while on patrol near Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen’s home in Washington.
title: Secret Service Agent on Patrol Fired Weapon Near Yellen’s Home

description: Treasury secretary nominee Scott Bessent plans to meet later this week with incoming Senate Republican leader John Thune and other key senators as he begins preparing for confirmation hearings.
title: Trump’s Treasury Pick to Meet Thune, Key Senators on Confirmation

description: Mozambique President Filipe Nyusi appointed Américo Letela as new attorney general as the nation awaits the Constitutional Council’s validation of October’s disputed elections.
title: Mozambique President Appoints Letela New Attorney General

description: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock said that NATO membership for Ukraine could be part of a potential peace deal with Russia, which could also include conceding some occupied Ukrainian territory.
title: Top German Diplomat Floats Ukraine NATO Membership as Part of Possible Peace Deal

description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol declared martial law late on Tuesday, accusing the opposition of trying to paralyze the administration. Here is the full text of Yoon’s televised speech.
title: Text of South Korean President’s Speech Imposing Martial Law

description: The US sanctioned 35 entities and vessels Tuesday that it said play a critical role in the shadow fleet transporting illicit Iranian oil to foreign markets.
title: US Targets Iranian Oil Shadow Fleet With Additional Sanctions

description: Hopes that Donald Trump’s presidential win would mean a fresh start for US policy toward Venezuela are starting to fade.
title: Investors Lose Faith in Venezuela Breakthrough Under Trump

description: Arthur Laffer has a word of advice for Argentina: Scrap capital controls now.
title: Laffer Tells Argentina ‘Get It Done Now’ on Capital Controls

description: The European Union needs common borrowing to compete with the United States and ensure a future of growth and innovation for the continent, European Central Bank Governing Council member Fabio Panetta said.
title: EU Needs Common Debt to Remain Competitive, ECB’s Panetta Says

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer signaled to his Greek counterpart Kyriakos Mitsotakis that the UK government wouldn’t block a potential deal to hand back the Parthenon sculptures, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Starmer Signals He Won’t Block Deal to Return Parthenon Marbles

description: Police guard the main gate of the National Assembly in Seoul on Dec. 3. Photographer: Jung Yeon-Je/Getty Images
title: South Korea’s Yoon Declares Emergency Martial Law

description: The Norwegian Parliament voted to extend abortion access to 18 weeks into a pregnancy, adding six weeks to a limit set in 1978 when the procedure was first legalized.
title: Norway Extends Abortion Access in Line With Sweden, Denmark

description: Pro-European Union protests risk escalating in Georgia because authorities are blocking off avenues to political dialog, the country’s president said.
title: Georgian President Warns Frustration in Pro-EU Protests Is Building

description: Where’s Emmanuel Macron?
title: Macron Hobnobs in Riyadh as French Government Nears Collapse

description: President Joe Biden touted his administration’s ties with Angola, including investment in a railway to deliver critical minerals across the continent as he met with Angolan President João Lourenço on Tuesday.
title: Biden Touts Lobito Project as First US Leader to Visit Angola

description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol declared martial law on Tuesday in an emergency national address televised live.
title: South Korea’s Yoon Declares Martial Law in Emergency Address

description: President Joe Biden’s Department of Labor is proposing to abolish below-minimum-wage pay for people with disabilities, targeting a long-controversial program whose fate will now rest with the incoming Trump administration.
title: US Seeks to End Subminimum Wage for Workers With Disabilities

description: TikTok executives said the social media platform removed a network covertly campaigning for Calin Georgescu, whose shock victory in the Nov. 24 presidential election threw the country into the biggest political crisis since the fall of communism.
title: TikTok Removes Covert Network Linked to Romanian Candidate

description: Donald Trump Jr. is joining the board of PSQ Holdings Inc., the owner of online marketplace PublicSquare, according to people with knowledge of the matter. The company’s shares almost doubled in early New York trading.
title: Donald Trump Jr. to Join Board of ‘Patriotic’ Marketplace PublicSquare

description: Flows from western ports surge, with impact of sanctions muted after two years
title: Russia’s Seaborne Crude Exports Jump Before Pivotal OPEC+ Talks

description: The US dockworkers’ union that walked out of every major East and Gulf coast port in October remains at loggerheads over technology in contract negotiations with their employers — with just six weeks left to reach a deal and prevent another strike.
title: US Dockworkers See Impasse at ‘Pivotal’ Time in Labor History

description: Iceland’s election winner, the Social Democrats, were tasked to start talks on forming the island nation’s next government.
title: Iceland’s Social Democrats to Kick Off Coalition Talks

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: US-China Rivalry Enters a New Arena in Africa

description: Surveys since Donald Trump’s election victory show American companies are growing more upbeat about their prospects in anticipation of more pro-business policies and less regulatory burden.
title: Trump’s Election Powers US Business Sentiment to Multi-Year High

description: The problem at carmaker Stellantis NV is “more about its ownership” rather than former Chief Executive Officer Carlos Tavares, according to Italian Deputy Premier Matteo Salvini.
title: Stellantis’s Problem Is Ownership Not CEO, Italy’s Salvini Says

description: German conservative opposition leader Friedrich Merz rowed back on recent sharp criticism of the Greens as he seeks to keep his options open for coalition partners if his CDU/CSU alliance wins February’s snap election.
title: German Conservatives Court Greens to Keep Coalition Options Open

description: The establishment of a new NATO command center for coordinating training and security assistance to Ukraine is running behind schedule, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: New NATO Center to Coordinate Ukraine Aid Falls Behind Schedule

description: French lawmakers will hold a no-confidence vote Wednesday, with far-right leader Marine Le Pen expected to join forces with a left-wing coalition to topple the government.
title: French Lawmakers to Vote Wednesday on Toppling the Government

description: India is prepared for a compromising approach while engaging with the incoming administration of Donald Trump to maintain its ties with the US, the South Asian nation’s foreign minister said.
title: India Open to Compromising Approach With Trump, Jaishankar Says

description: China ratcheted up trade tensions with the US with a ban on several materials with high-tech and military applications, in a tit-for-tat move after President Joe Biden’s government escalated technology curbs on Beijing.
title: China Dials Up US Trade Tension With Tit-for-Tat Metals Ban

description: China has now lifted all restrictions on exports from Australian meat works, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said, marking a new milestone in warming relations between the two governments.
title: China Lifts Last Australia Meat Processor Bans, Albanese Says

description: One of India’s worst GDP growth misses in recent memory is suddenly adding more pressure on central bank Governor Shaktikanta Das, who still hasn’t gotten an extension even though his term expires next week.
title: Speculation Over RBI Chief’s Future Heats Up After GDP Miss

description: Financial and technical problems are fueling concern about whether the bloc can revamp its approach to borders
title: Atos Consortium Fumbles Rollout of EU Biometric Border System

description: Donald Trump reiterated his opposition to the sale of United States Steel Corp. to Nippon Steel Corp., saying he’d instead use tariffs and tax incentives to revive the American steelmaker.
title: Trump Reiterates Opposition to US Steel Sale, Pledges Tariff Fix

description: A Hong Kong court has overturned the government’s conditional approval for building public housing on part of an exclusive golf course that’s popular among elites, local media reported.
title: Hong Kong Court Halts Plan for Public Housing on Golf Course

description: President-elect Donald Trump plans to travel to Paris on Saturday to attend the reopening of the Cathedral of Notre Dame, which was devastated by fire in 2019.
title: Trump Will Visit Paris to Celebrate Reopening of Notre Dame

description: Vietnamese property tycoon Truong My Lan is set to hear whether she’ll be spared execution as a court prepares to rule on her appeal against the death sentence for masterminding the country’s largest ever fraud scandal.
title: Mogul Seeks to Avoid Execution in Vietnam’s Biggest Fraud Case
